title: How to Make a Red Meat Sauce

steps.headline: Make the bouquet garni.
steps.description: Take a section of cooking string and lay it out across a clean, dry surface. Stack sage, rosemary, parsley, thyme and bay leaves in the middle of the string lengthwise, and tie the herbs together into a tight bundle. Tie the herbs together tightly so they do not separate during the cooking process.

steps.headline: Par boil, peel and crush the tomatoes.
steps.description: Core 10 large tomatoes and place them in boiling water for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove the tomatoes and place them under cold running water. Peal the skin off of the tomatoes and and place them on a clean cutting surface. Crush the peeled tomatoes using the flat side of a chef's knife. Set the tomatoes aside.

steps.headline: Prepare the onions, celery and garlic.
steps.description: Peel and chop 4 large onions and 4 to 5 cloves of garlic, and set aside. Trim and chop 4 celery stalks into small cubes and set aside.

steps.headline: Brown the meat.
steps.description: Add 5 tbsp. of olive oil to a heavy saucepan on medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add 18 oz. of meat and stir frequently. Before the meat has completely browned, stir in the celery, onions and garlic. Continue to stir until the meat is evenly browned on all sides.

steps.headline: Combine the remaining ingredients and simmer.
steps.description: Add the crushed and peeled tomatoes to the sauce and cook them for about 10 minutes. Then add 8 oz. of red wine, 12 oz. of beef stock, salt, pepper and the bouquet garni to the sauce. Allow the sauce to simmer, stirring occasionally, for a minimum of 2 hours. The red meat sauce, or bolognaise, is complete and ready to serve.

Add 5 tbsp. of olive oil to a heavy saucepan on medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add 18 oz. of meat and stir frequently. Before the meat has completely browned, stir in the celery, onions and garlic. Continue to stir until the meat is evenly browned on all sides. Combine the remaining ingredients and simmer. Add the crushed and peeled tomatoes to the sauce and cook them for about 10 minutes. Then add 8 oz. of red wine, 12 oz. of beef stock, salt, pepper and the bouquet garni to the sauce.
